metadata.Title: CVE-2023-22998 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In the Linux kernel before 6.0.3, drivers/gpu/drm/virtio/virtgpu_object.c misinterprets the drm_gem_shmem_get_sg_table return value (expects it to be NULL in the error case, whereas it is actually an error pointer).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-22998` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-60-generic - 5.15.0-60.66
linux-image-5.15.0-60-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-60.66
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-60-generic - 5.15.0-60.66
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-60-generic-64k - 5.15.0-60.66
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1030-aws - 5.15.0-1030.34
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-60.66').
linux-aws package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1030.34').
linux-aws-6.2 package in jammy is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
linux-azure package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1033.40').
linux-azure-5.19 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-1020.21~22.04.1').
